poem:
"Consequence of Protest"

Inked upon silent sheets of law,
Wrestlers of justice stride,
Their disruptive voices barred
Yet unbound in hearts worldwide.
In habitude, the oak and maple's sway,
A chorus defiant, a natural ballet.
Though power seeks to quell their tide,
Flowers protest from the wild's untamed side.
Their bloom, un-proscribed, finds a way.
